results.title: At U.Va., an Alumnus Attacked Diversity Programs. Now He Is on the Board.

results.adx_keywords: Jews and Judaism;Middle Ages (Historical Period);Historic Buildings and Sites;Travel and Vacations;Anti-Semitism;York (England);Norwich (England)
results.title: Turning Over the Stones of England’s Lost Jewish Past
results.abstract: Around eight centuries ago, Jews thrived in England, worshiping freely and living where they pleased. Then everything changed. You can uncover their stories, if you know where to look.

media.caption: Clifford’s Tower, the site of a massacre in which nearly the entire Jewish population of York, England, was killed in 1190. But even after this slaughter, Jews returned to York and prospered under the king’s protection.
media.copyright: Andy Haslam for The New York Times

results.title: Overlooked No More: Elizabeth Wagner Reed, Who Resurrected Legacies of Women in Science
results.abstract: Reed made several discoveries in genetics and dedicated her career toward supporting women scientists. Yet she herself fell into obscurity.

media.caption: Elizabeth Wagner Reed in about 1946 with her son, John. Though her husband died in World War II, leaving her alone to raise her son, she continued pursuing her career in science.
